alert.note: Alert for Greene; Oconee; Oglethorpe (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 11 at 8:51PM EST until January 13 at 8:15AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Ocmulgee River near Macon affecting Houston, Twiggs, Monroe, Bibb and Jones Counties. Oconee River near Penfield affecting Oglethorpe, Greene and Oconee Counties. Oconee River at Avant Mine near Oconee affecting Wilkinson and Washington Counties. Oconee River near Oconee affecting Johnson, Wilkinson and Washington Counties. For the Ocmulgee River Basin...including Jackson, Juliette, Griffin, Juliette, Macon, Dames Ferry, Macon, Clinchfield, Hawkinsville, Hawkinsville, Byron, Abbeville, McRae, Scotland, Lumber City... Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Oconee River Basin...including Penfield, Milledgeville, Oconee, Oconee, McIntyre, Irwinton, Oconee, Dublin, Mount Vernon... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Oconee River near Penfield. * WHEN...Until Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18 feet, Moderate flooding begins. Ward Road floods and cuts off access to L.C. Curtis and Son Sand and Gravel Company. Irrigation systems also begin to flood and need to be moved to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM EST Thursday the stage was 19.5 feet and steady. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain near a crest of 19.5 feet tonight. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 13 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 900 AM EST.
